questions.question: There are some beautiful ………………………… trees in the garden.
questions.description: We use tall for people, buildings, trees etc.

questions.question: The prison has got very ………………………. walls.
questions.description: Generally speaking, tall is used for things that are higher than they are wide. High is used in other cases.

questions.question: Which is the ………………………………. mountain in the world?
That building is about 300 feet ……………………………..
questions.description: In measurements we usually use high for things and tall for people.

questions.question: He is 6 feet ………………………………
questions.description: In measurements we usually use high for things and tall for people.

questions.question: The shelves were too ……………………………… for me to reach.
questions.description: We use tall to talk about distance above ground.

questions.question: You have got lovely ……………………………… fingers.
questions.description: We use long for parts of the body.

questions.question: Can you help me ……………………………….. this problem?
questions.description: Help is followed by object + infinitive with or without to.

questions.question: I ……………………………….. somebody coming.
questions.description: The word hear is not normally used in the progressive form.

questions.question: I could see him ………………………………… the bus.
questions.description: Only the ing form is used after can see or could see.

questions.question: You ………………………………. disturb me when I am working
questions.description: The negative form is usually made with had better + not + infinitive.

questions.question: I will pay you back when I ……………………………. a job.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the future tense, we use simple present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.
